sen.j: 近衛 信尹（このえ のぶただ 永禄8年11月1日 (旧暦)(1565年11月23日) - 慶長19年11月25日 (旧暦)(1614年12月25日)）は、安土桃山時代の公家。
sen.e: Nobutada KONOE (November 23, 1565-December 25, 1614) was a court noble lived in the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.

sen.j: 近衛前久の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Sakihisa KONOE.

sen.e: His mother was a lady in waiting of the Konoe family.

sen.e: His original name was Nobumoto then changed to Nobusuke.

His pen name was Sanmyakuin.

sen.j: 天正5年(1577年)元服。
sen.e: He went through genpuku (a ceremony to celebrate a young man's coming of age) in 1577.
He celebrated his coming of age in 1577.

sen.j: 加冠の役をつとめたのが織田信長で、信長の一字を貰い信基と名乗る。
sen.e: The person who performed kakan (put a crown on a young man's head on a genpuku ceremony) was Nobunaga ODA and he got one character of the name of Nobunaga and called himself Nobumoto.

The kakan (where a crown is put on the head of the person coming of age) was performed by Nobunaga ODA, who gave him permission to use one character of the name of Nobunaga and he took the name Nobumoto.

sen.j: 天正8年(1580年)に内大臣、天正13年(1585年)左大臣となる。
sen.e: In 1580, he assumed the position of Naidaijin (managerial position who supports Emperor), then Sadaijin (minister of the left) in 1585.
In 1580, he assumed the position of Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), then Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 1585.

sen.j: 関白の位をめぐり二条昭実と口論（関白相論）となり、菊亭晴季の蠢動で、豊臣秀吉に関白就任の口実を与えてしまった。
sen.e: He got into an argument with Akizane NIJO over the position of Kanpaku (the chief adviser to the Emperor) (it is called "Kanpaku Soron") and provided Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI an excuse for assuming the position of Kanpaku due to the shundo(maneuver) by Harusue KIKUTEI.
sen.cmt: 関白相論→Kanpaku Soron[定訳不明。直前で内容が説明されているので、この語の後に入れる説明は省きました]
sen.e: He got into an argument with Akizane NIJO over the position of Kanpaku (the chief adviser to the Emperor), an incident known as the "Kanpaku Soron", which, following maneuvering by Harusue KIKUTEI, provided Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI with an excuse for assuming the position of Kanpaku.

sen.cmt: カンマを位置を移動しました。

sen.j: 実に藤原氏一門以外の者が関白についたのは、秀吉と甥の豊臣秀次だけである。
sen.e: In fact, only Hideyoshi and his nephew, Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI were the persons who assumed the position of Kanpaku other than the Fujiwara clan.

sen.e: In fact, Hideyoshi and his nephew, Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, were the only people to assume the position of Kanpaku not from the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 秀吉が秀次に関白位を譲ったことに、内心、穏やかではなく、文禄元年(1592年)正月に左大臣を辞した。
sen.e: He was privately upset by the fact that Hideyoshi transferred the position of kanpaku to Hidetsugu and resigned from the position of Sadaijin in January, 1592.
Nobutada was privately upset by the fact that Hideyoshi transferred the position of Kanpaku to Hidetsugu and resigned from the position of Sadaijin in January, 1592.

sen.j: 信尹は、幼い頃から父とともに地方で過ごし、帰京後も公家よりも信長の小姓らと仲良くする機会が多かったために武士に憧れていたという（天正18年（1590年）に書かれた菊亭晴季あての手紙）。
sen.e: It is said that Nobutada yearned for samurai since he spent his early life in the provinces with his father and had more opportunities to get along with Nobunaga's pageboys than with the court nobles after he went back to Kyoto (written in the letter to Harusue KIKUTEI in 1590).
sen.cmt: 小姓→pageboy[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: According to a letter received by Harusue KIKUTEI in 1590, it was said that Nobutada, who spent his early years in the provinces and even after returning to Kyoto had more opportunities to make friends with Nobunaga's pageboys than with the nobles, admired the samurai.

According to a letter received by Harusue KIKUTEI in 1590, it was said that Nobutada, who spent his early years in the provinces and even after returning to Kyoto had more opportunities to make friends with Nobunaga's pageboys than with the nobles, admired the samurai.

sen.j: 秀吉が朝鮮出兵の兵を起こすや否や、文禄元年12月に自身も朝鮮に渡海するため京都を出奔し肥前名護屋に赴いた。
sen.e: As soon as Hideyoshi directed his forces against Korea, he ran away from Kyoto and went off to Hizen Nagoya in order to cross the sea to Korea in December, 1592.

As soon as Hideyoshi directed his forces against Korea, he ran away from Kyoto and went off to Hizen Nagoya in order to cross the sea to Korea in January, 1593 (December, 1592 in lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 後陽成天皇は宸襟を悩ましたてまつり、勅書を秀吉に賜って信尹の渡海をくい止めようとされた。
sen.e: The Emperor Goyozei puzzled over the event and sent a chokusho (an official document from Emperor) to Hideyoshi to prevent Nobutada from crossing the sea.
sen.cmt: 「宸襟」という名詞を使うと文章が不自然になるため、「頭を悩ませていた」としました。
sen.e: The Emperor Goyozei puzzled over the event and sent an imperial rescript to Hideyoshi to prevent Nobutada from crossing the sea.

sen.e: The Emperor Goyozei puzzled over the event and sent an imperial rescript to Hideyoshi to prevent Nobutada from crossing the sea.

sen.j: 廷臣としては余りに奔放な行動であり、更に菊亭晴季らが讒言（前述の手紙には「関白が豊臣氏の世襲になるならばせめて内覧任命を希望したい」という文言が入っていた事が問題になったと言われている）したため、文禄3年(1594年)4月についに後陽成天皇の勅勘を蒙る羽目に陥った。
sen.e: Since his conduct was too bold for a retainer of the Imperial Court, in addition, Harusue KIKUTEI made zangen (a false charge) (it is said that the foregoing letter included a phrase like "If the position of Kanpaku is transferred by succession, I hope to assign him at least as Nairan (a position of the person who see documents sent for the Emperor in advance)
